info.name: Cloud Failover Extension (CFE)
info.description: This class is focused on highlighting the F5 Automation Toolchain objects and their specific uses.

item.name: Authentication
Retrieve Authentication Token BIGIP1
Set Authentication Token Timeout BIGIP1
Retrieve Authentication Token BIGIP2
Set Authentication Token Timeout BIGIP2
Installation
Step 1: List Installed iControl LX Extensions on BIGIP1
Step 2: Upload CFE Extension RPM to BIGIP1

exec: // Create the value for the Content-Range header based on the file size of the RPM

item.name: Step 3: Create CFE Extension Install Task BIGIP1
Step 4: Get CFE Install Task Status BIGIP1
Step 5: Check CFE is Installed on BIGIP1
Step 6: Get existing CFE Configuration on BIGIP1
Step 7: List CFE objects on BIGIP1
Step 8: List Installed iControl LX Extensions on BIGIP2
Step 9: Upload CFE Extension RPM to BIGIP2

exec: // Create the value for the Content-Range header based on the file size of the RPM

item.name: Step 10: Create CFE Extension Install Task BIGIP2
Step 11: Get CFE Install Task Status BIGIP2
Step 12: Check CFE is Installed on BIGIP2
Step 13: Get existing CFE Configuration on BIGIP2
Step 14: List CFE objects on BIGIP2
Modify Configuration
Step 1: Get existing CFE Configuration on BIGIP1
Step 2: Get existing CFE Configuration on BIGIP2
Step 3: List CFE objects on BIGIP1
Step 4: List CFE objects on BIGIP2
Step 5:  Push Configuration - BIGIP1
Step 6:  Push Configuration - BIGIP2
Trigger Failover
Step 1: Get HA Status on BIGIP1
Step 2: Get HA Status on BIGIP2
Step 3: Trigger Failover BIGIP1
Step 4: Trigger Failover BIGIP2
Step 4: Check HA Failover Status BIGIP1
Step 5: Check HA Failover Status BIGIP2
Reset CFE Configuration
Step 1: Get HA Status on BIGIP1
Step 2: Get HA Status on BIGIP2
Step 3: Manually SAVE existing CFE Configuration on BIGIP1
Step 4: Manually SAVE existing CFE Configuration on BIGIP2
Step 5: ** RESET ** CFE Configuration will be cleared on BIGIP1
Step 6: ** RESET ** CFE Configuration will be cleared on BIGIP2
